name: Campus Automobile Spa-Francorchamps
goal:
Campus Automobile is the skill centre of the Walloon Region, located in Spa-Francorchamps, inside the race track. The main goals of Campus are:
• To provide technical trainings to job seekers, to the public of schools (students and teachers) and for workers;
• To follow the evolution of technologies and adapt / create training contents;
• To support the economic development of his local area thanks to a partnership with SPI (incubator of companies) and an industrial area;
• To support regional SME’s with its specific equipment;
• To support education through a partnership with ULg (master program of 60 credits in sustainable mobility organised in Francorchamps);
• To provide competences in automotive, racing, bodywork, engines, alternative fuels and eco-technology (biofuels, gaseous fuels, electricity, FCH, EV and Hybrid technologies) thanks to our high-tech equipment through workshops in automotive garage, machining, electricity, welding, composites material, engine test bench, chassis dyno., electro-mechanics;
• To support the innovation in the automotive industry.

Experience
Campus has provided 120 000 hours of training in 2015 in 12 different kinds of training sections for technicians in the automotive sector in the fields “Mechanics”, “Industry” and “New technologies”.
interests: Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Transport
euInitiatives: The Campus follows the EU directives on equity, transparency, Integration and support EU citizen through vocational training.
